p: It has been suggested that the increase of extracellular glutamate occurs mainly due to an anomaly in glutamate transporter EAAT2/GLT-1 and leads to ALS. Harmine, a beta-carboline alkaloid, may act by activating EAAT2/GLT-1 gene expression increasing the cellular uptake of glutamate [ 29]. The indirect mechanism was suggested by the use of alkaloids with commercial drug Riluzole, aiming to block the increased levels of P-glycoprotein in the blood-brain barrier (BBB) [ 30]. In this sense, Lopez and Martinez-Luis showed that polyaromatic alkaloids from prosobranch mollusk ( Lamellaria sp.) restrain P-gp, demonstrating an increased cellular uptake to different drugs in resistant cell line [ 31]. However, in this review, we will highlight the benefits of its mechanism of action as antioxidants, since alkaloids have the ability to convert free radical species in inactive substances [ 32, 33]. Thus, researches have explored the advantages of employing alkaloids with this purpose, alone or included in a pharmaceutical form and from several sources [ 34â€“ 37].
